I used to make me endure different sorts of pain, from over working out, running until I vomit or plain cutting, bruising.
It took time for me to figure out that something was wrong for starters. I though everybody was like that and I didn't understand peaceful people, people able to build joy for themselves.
Then I realized that I was hating myself.. or more precisely that something had been put in me, deeply, making me hate myself, like I had no choice.
In fact, much later, my mother told me she didn't want to have kids and was put under pressure by her step family to have one, me. She regretted it all the way and fell into depression as her own past resurfaced: her own mother always made clear that she hated having a girl, herself being from a home where her own mother allegedly tried to kill her... a long chain of mother-daughter brutality.
Plus my mother saw me as the chain keeping her bound to my father, a man that couldn't emancipate himself from his own father.
I was sometimes weaponized by my parents against each other.
The result is that it subconsciously convinced me, in the deeper layers of my mind, that I was a mistake, or worse, the "thing that should not be". This led me to self annihilation habits where my body should suffer and be ultimately shred to pieces so that nobody could acknowledge I existed. Death was not enough in a sense.

>>28240590
>Does self-harm make you feel better or worse (physically speaking)?
I don't self-harm, but I've known quite a few people who do. In the short term it certainly makes you feel better. Pain causes the body to release endorphins; so you are generating opioids inside the body when you do it. That has a calming effect - there's a strong sense of release; it helps you cope with stress and negative emotion, and can even make you feel kind of high. It is literally physically addictive after a while, of course, in the same way as taking opioid painkillers. People who self harm sometimes go on to become masochists, which is actually a lot safer if you're with a sadist who knows what he's doing - gives you an intense pain high without the scars.

The problem is that they're weak, broken men who probably didn't have a strong father figure in their life and/or had a domineering mother that ruthlessly controlled every aspect of their lives to the point of infantalization.

Everyone is broken to some degree, but I'd wager 4channers with the "Nobody will ever love me" mentality are more broken than the average individual. True love is reciprocated, meaning that you'll have as much to offer to the other person as the other person has to you. Literally, the world is a better place for everyone with somebody loving you, provided that you actually love them back.

Chanting the "Nobody will ever love me" mantra is a self-fulfilling prophecy. You need to cut that shit out. There's been research into this type of thinking, and more specifically, weak or submissive body posture being a net negative for people who do it. It's a vicious cycle: people who are perceived to be weak get less and people who are perceived to be strong get more. You need a foundation to build confidence and self-respect off of. For a lot of people, that is going to the gym. For others, it's applying yourself at a skill and advancing through a job. You need to be oriented towards something besides anime, video games, and porn to gain actual self-respect and admiration from other people.

> Is there any point living as an incel?
Plenty. It'd be a massive lie to say sex and romantic intimacy don't matter at all - but radical incels are caught in the opposite massive lie, that it's all-consumingly important to the point that it should be considered a Maslow level need immediately after food, water, and shelter. I fundamentally disagree with this.

As an ex-incel till like 29, the truth is that the overwhelming majority of life's joys and one's appreciation for them do not emerge from vagina or having women in your life that want to sleep with you. Sex feels nice, but jerking off achieves the same physical results. The romantic and emotional intimacy of a partner feel nice, but not to the point that if you had a good friendship with someone you'd blindly accept exchanging it away to have that intimacy. Sexual and romantic emotional intimacy are very nice, but neither are going to make you feel "whole" if you don't already - and even when you have them, you won't guaranteed prefer it to alternatives, as they come at significant personal costs.

There are harsh tradeoffs to getting laid or dating. Even when you're dick-deep in pussy or in a truly loving relationship, you will, without a single hint of irony, miss those times when you were single and without women, because in those times, you were truly free. Dating or fucking around usually demands about 2-3 days of your free time a week to maintain personal standards, socialize, and keep up with needed bullshit, and I guarantee that you're already filling that time with stuff you need to do or enjoy - to get women, you must surrender parts of your life, parts you find important and meaningful, to make the space for these women. It's NOT a guaranteed winning trade.

Focus on building a life you find meaningful where you spend time with people you care about, who also care about you. This is the true element that incels feel that they are missing - and you don't need sex or women to have it.

Privileged men (both handsome and neurotypical, aka "Chad") live in a constant positive feedback loop. They get the best (prettiest, warmest, smartest) girls without trying. Girls look at Chads like at answer to their prayers. With unconditional tenderness. No, not only obnoxious Stacies love Chad naturally. That shy, smart, quirky loner girl, she TOO masturbates to pretty, tall (anime) boys, not below average looking men.

Incels live in a constant negative feedback loop. They have to hit on the inferior girls Chad left over. These leftover girls look at incels like at the compromise they are. With cold consideration. Allow your emotions to process in their own uniquely subtle ways. Don't smother or deny them. They're a part of you, and it's worth discovering and mastering yourself during your time here. Don't ever think that you're nothing, an absolute nobody, for "letting" these things happen. There truly is a simple beauty to being alive, and you literally don't know what's going to happen in your future. Understand and purge your anger, hate, and shame, lest they control you and trap you in negative feedback loops and crushing self-fulfilling prophecies. You're not alone in any of this man, and in spite of all the demoralizing blackpill shit we're all bombarded by, there always will be genuine moments worth continuing for.
Remember: 7 billion people. There are people worth meeting still.

>one day suddenly it stops all pressure and have no hot water
>Heating still works (got a gas water boiler)
>Call plumber
>He says it's the boiler
>calcium deposits have stopped the flow over time and now is fully blocked
>Have to change boiler
>Agree because this boiler is already +10 years old and I will have to change it sooner or later
>Thing is that there is hot water pressure as long as the heating is on
>Anyway, plumber brings in the new boiler
>Still no hot water pressure
>Plumber says it might be the main valve that comes after the boiler that has been calcified
>Anohter plumber from the same company comes the next day to take out the valve
>he does
>still no hot water pressure
>only when the heating is on
>now the plumber says that all the water instalation of the appartment is calcified and I need to do an acid purge of the system to clear it from calcium

Am I being scammed or are they truly clueless? They could have done the acid purge before taking out the valve. And having hot water pressure while the heating is on but none when it is off makes no sense to me. I guess the only thing obstructing the hot water is calcium deposits on the system, but this does not explain why I get water pressure once I turn the heating on.

Any plumber can lend me a hand?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28247576
The water you drink from or the water you use to heat your home?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>> Am I being scammed or are they truly clueless?

Neither. They are trying to diagnose your problem. They're not magic, they can't magically see where a blockage is, anymore than a mechanic can know exactly what's wrong with your car, police can magically know who did it or doctors can magically know what's wrong with you.

It all works on deduction based on experience. It's working backwards from the most common and likely cause in this situation, towards the least likely.

They know there's a calcium blockage somewhere, it's just a matter of finding it. Evidently the most common source of these kinds of blockages in this kind of system is the boiler, followed by the main valve. They're trying to save you money, but you've just been unlucky enough that your blockage isn't in the common bracket. So now they're hoping that purging the system with acid will clear the issue, but it might not and they'll have to try something else.

>> but this does not explain why I get water pressure once I turn the heating on.

Actually is does. It's basic physics. What happens in a closed system when you heat a thermal conductor? You get pressure in your pipes with the heating on for the same reason steam trains work.

>>28244152
>I read in a lot of places that not masturbating gives you lots of energy, more focused thinking and a lot of good things, is that really true?

I'm a month in to nofap (my personal record after 20 years of daily beating it) and I can confirm that there are positive effects.\

You'll have more energy. Do yourself a favour and burn it by doing something physical or going out and socialising, otherwise you'll go stir crazy and fall back into old habits.

Your thinking will be more focused, but it'll mostly be focused on wanting to jack it for at least the first 2 weeks. The fantasies and mental images you'll be creating the first week or two are intense. They were so good that I used to jack it once every 2 weeks because those thoughts were better than actually doing the deed. Don't fall for your brain's tricks. Stay strong.

After a few weeks you'll gain a drive to talk to people and women that you wouldn't find attractive in the past suddenly become something you desperately want to put your cock into.

Your confidence levels will rise.

I had success by tapering off rather than going cold turkey. Over a couple of months, cut it down to once a day, then twice a week, then once a week, then see how long you can go. Staying away from porn will make this much easier for you.

Don't beat yourself up if you stumble. It happens. Every time you fail, you'll be able to get that initial rush of good things again. As long as you don't let yourself fall back into it, that'll help to keep you focused on the goal.

>Post an interesting fact you know and your gender!
M. Of all the species on Earth that have male and female individuals, only a tiny minority have any connection between sex and the presence or absence of a Y chromosome. (Which is why, as literally any biologist will tell you, the presence or absence of a Y cannot possibly ever be what defines a male or female animal in any species, humans included).

Platypuses, for example, are XXXXXYYYYY - both male and female. Birds have W and Z chromosomes instead of X and Y. In reptiles, amphibians, fish, and invertebrates, sex isn't determined by genetics at all, but by environmental factors - in crocodiles, for example, it's controlled by the temperature at which the egg incubates.

>>28247123
Suppose we conduct an experiment to measure the speed of light in a vacuum, and we find out that it is very slightly faster than we thought. Before the experiment, the speed of light in a vacuum was regarded as being exactly 299792458m/s. After the experiment, the speed of light in a vacuum is still regarded as being exactly 299792458m/s, even though it is faster than we previously thought, because the consequence of the experiment is that we have updated the definition of how long a metre is in order to keep that true.

So, a fact is that light travels significantly slower through glass than it does through a vacuum. That's not part of the definition of "light" or "glass", it's a property of those things. Saying that a triangle has three sides is not a fact, it's just part of the way that we define the word "triangle".

I see this as just a variant on the typical argument that "You should worship God in your way, and me in my way." Thus I will respond with something that moved me to reject this argument.
>We want to be saved, but in our own way, not God's. Very often one hears it said that men ought to be free to worship God, each in his own way. This indeed is true, so far as it implies freedom of conscience and each man's duty of living up to the special lights that God has given him. But it can be very wrong if it means that we worship God in our way and not in His. Consider an analogy: the traffic situation would be tangled and desperate if we said that the American way of life allowed every man to drive a car in his way and not according to the traffic laws. Catastrophe would result if patients began saying to the doctor, "I want to be cured in my own way, but not in yours," or if citizens said to the government,"I want to pay my taxes, but in my own way and not in yours." Similarly, there is a tremendous egotism and conceit in those popular articles and lectures entitled "My Idea of Religion," or "My Idea of God." An individual religion can be as misleading and uninforrned as an individual astronomy or an individual mathematics.
>Individuals who say, ''I will serve God in my way, and you serve God in your way," ought to inquire whether it would not be advisable to serve God in His Way. But it is precisely this prospect of a stable, universally true religion which frightens the modern soul. For if his conscience is uneasy he wants, instead, a religion which will leave out hell. If he has already married again against the law of Christ, he wants a religion that does not condemn divorce. Such a reservation means that a man wants to be saved, not in God's way, but in his. In thus refusing to moult his vain desires, he misses the flight to that "Love that leaves all other beauty pain."

posts.sub: In this thread we are going to look for the cure for depression
posts.com:
I have no proof or medical studies to show that this is the case, but I also have no doubts. I believe that to get out of depression, tiredness, fatigue and all that shit, you first have to work your body, since a healthy body is a healthy mind, for that it is good to do sports, whatever it is. it is as long as it keeps our body busy. Another important factor is studying, it doesn't really matter what, it doesn't matter if it's for university, school or for yourself, you have to do it to keep your mind occupied with something productive. I would also say that looking for a job, or generating income with a startup, as this will keep our mind and body busy, while giving us money, in itself gives us a reason to keep going, especially when you are working on something of your own.

Another important point is to stop comparing yourself to others, stop thinking that the other is better than you because you have more knowledge, money or physical condition. It is also very silly to think about issues such as superiority or inferiority, we are all human, we all have problems and difficulties in life, of course there are degrees of this, but this does not have to be a limitation. You have to focus on yourself, on your problems, on your virtues, on your life, and not on that of others.

Another issue is guilt and remorse, which depending on the person can be the easiest part, or difficult to overcome, because it is easy to forgive others, but sometimes it is difficult, if not impossible, to forgive yourself. No matter how dirty your hands are, they can always be cleaned. You have to accept your sins, accept what you did wrong and live with it. Go to a priest, a psychologist, or tell someone you trust what you did, this can help, it doesn't matter if you think psychology is a joke, or if you don't believe in God, the important thing is to somehow get the weight off What are you wearing.

posts.com: think you need to begin with the question of why do people in general feel emotions to begin to answer why someone would fall into a perpetual negative emotional state. Emotions are clearly intrinsic instincts not learned although learned experiences can change what triggers the emotions to occur. These instincts evolved over time to prod people towards the actions that have proven to be evolutionarily successful over time. Because people are highly social animals and there is fierce competition between different social groups of people, many of the emotions we feel are actually designed to not simply benefit yourself and improve your own survival, but to benefit the survival of the entire social group. These instincts go hand in hand with developed cultural mores.

>>28220657
It all comes down to conditioning.

From the most recent trigger or episode to your emotional trauma that sets off depression.
Or the cycle of trauma and pain you repeat and keep yourself in.
Down to traumatic events that have a lifelong impact on your psyche.

The necessary systems in place for recovery are 'safety', 'hope of recovery and future', an environment that fosters these two things as well as the social justice aspect, meaning you get the recognition of trauma you were dealt and the perpetrator dealt with. (but in the case of Act of God events, it's rationalisation through the reality of what happened)

This means, identifying things in your environment and social groups as well as your past, that negatively affect you. Doing your best to distance and remove those obstacles in your life and then having the 'stability' of an environment that is conducive to positive feedback cycles and a normalisation of ptsd behaviour responses in order to become and feel normal.

Lack of hope is another big reason, but this falls back to conditioning and a lack of positive feedback cycles fueling your worldview. If your metaphysical understanding of the universe is lacking, you won't see the point of your individualism in the big picture.
>seek god
>or develop another useful schema (evolution)


Depression is just when life beats you down and you lack the insight and motivation or opportunity to actually make a change. It's as simple as that.

We cannot say whether or not you should take antidepressants, you must attend one or two sessions with a psychiatrist and tell him about your problems, and he will determine whether or not you have depression. You can be a functional, charismatic person, who bathes, goes to work, studies, and does everything well, but if apathy (loss of interest in things), a feeling of emptiness, and physical symptoms such as fatigue from nothing , then you may have depression, especially with those suicidal thoughts that you have.
Therapy can also help, but if you go to several sessions, tell them all your problems and see that it doesn't help you, it's better to change someone better. Do not stay with the first option, if you do not like something you are always free to go and change.

>>28216868
Here’s you. You don’t know yourself very well.

And over there is society, your parents, peers etc. Tv screens, schools… They’ve been telling you all your life what a “good person” is. Maybe you felt you are not good enough the way you are.

That causes trauma. Sounds dramatic, but all it means is that pain causes you to reject certain aspects of yourself.

This rejection functions by repression, preventing who you are from being made conscious. And therefore you have low self-awareness. You also have a feeling of need. You don’t feel whole.

For the places where you rejected yourself, you do not know what you really want. You’ve disconnected from yourself. Instead, what you’re doing is aspiring to make yourself conform to the image society has programmed onto you. This is the trap of self-image.

The maintenance of a self-image is a burden, motivated by anxiety and pain. You may be good at it, or you may be so handicapped by it, that it extinguishes you, and it completely prevents you from knowing what you actually want.

In the latter example, you are sure you know what you want, you just “can’t get yourself to do it”. It is the poor self-awareness at work, because of the trauma. And that is how you get depressed.

It is getting stuck in a lie, that you are unwilling to let go of (that you have to be/do better), because you are sure that you are worthless as you are.

>>28216868
I think the most important thing is a combination of social support and validation.

Some seek validation through sex or long-term relationships, or through their careers. Without this, people will doubt themselves and have low confidence. Sometimes validation can be internal, but that requires an unusually strong moral foundation and a lot of willpower. Most people will seek this through social interactions. I honestly believe that being romantically valued is vital to a persons mental health - you are being judged by another person and found worthy of their commitment and attention. Social media is being used as a replacement for IRL validation, and we all see how that's going.

The requirement for social support is a phycological need to know that you have a safety net (social, emotional and physical) in case something goes wrong that you can't handle on your own. If you don't have this support you'll be subconsciously aware of your own vulnerability to disasters, like medical emergencies or times of hardship. Humans are pack animals, and knowing that you have a "tribe" that has your back is a very primal need for us. The state to some extent has fulfilled the "physical" aspect, but not the emotional or social.

In my experience both personal and from observing others, these two needs are absolute and cannot be replaced. Trying to substitute them with other distractions is only a temporary measure and will eventually fail.

posts.com:
I've been depressed for 3 years or so. Started with COVID lockdowns.

The first year, I had no idea I was depressed. I just kinda lost motivation, lost focus, lost memory. I ate a lot more, was impulsive, lost all my passions. Probably one of the last symptoms I got was just feeling numb all the time.

I need to go to the dentist because I wasn't brushing my teeth. And there a whole bunch of shitty effects (I am poorer, fatter, etc)


I have never recovered to my previous self, but I know that the gym really helps me. I take Adderall, but the effect barely works now, but it's good enough. I think changing your environment and doing novel things also helps.


I think depression stems from various things. But being lonely, feeling as if you have no possessions, feeling trapped/lack of control, etc are all big factors. Things start to spiral, and shit gets worse. Every day feels the same, and like a chore, etc.

In my case, my family & lack of friends/clubs seem to be the problem. But I'm kinda stuck (which is also a problem).

>>28246294
I'm not saying to just magically stop being depressed. Changing your mindset and the way you view the world around you is possible and is necessary to get rid of your depression, but I never said it would be easy. What you think about the world, and what you think about yourself is absolutely contributing to your depression. Another thing is unhealthy habits, and how you view your own life. Find a way to change these things for the better. Don't view the world as bleak and hopeless, don't compulsively compare yourself to others, don't view your life as a tragedy, and yourself a victim. No negative self talk. Believe in yourself and your ability to pull yourself out of shitty situations. Have gratitude and appreciate what you do have, instead of dwelling on the past and focusing on what was lost. Appreciate the small things.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28246463
>i just dont have the energy or drive to do anything.

Not the anon you're talking to, but this is one part of the mindset that you have to break. A major part.

My advice is to just do that thing you should be doing, whether you feel like you have the energy or not. Your brain actively works against you when you're depressed. Sometimes you have to ignore what it's telling you, which sometimes means forcing yourself to ignore every thought beyond "I should do that thing".

When you've done the thing you need to congratulate yourself. Even if you think the thing is ultimately inconsequential or so small it isn't worth it, the fact is that you did it, and that's more than you were able to do yesterday. And that's what will lead to progress.

Start small, with things you can do right now with no preparation. Work up to the big stuff.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28245020
All kinds of fasting will do it. All kinds of out of the ordinary activities do it to varying extents. Everything is best done without any expectations. Including nofap if you want to try it anyway. Something as simple as planting a plant. Otherwise, if you can go to a fight gym, that definitely will. If you have a cold ocean you can get in for a few minutes, you literally cannot exit the same mood you entered. Showers as cold as they’ll go, in my opinion, are both less effective and more torturous, but they’ll do it if there’s no ocean. And if you like the ocean, you can build an ice tub from a freezer fairly simply.

Also, I think one important thing I learned was that my idea of getting better… It was far too based in the depression itself. I took the depression too seriously, so a lot of the hopeful moments I had were actually just the other side of the same coin, and they reinforced the depression. Actually getting better was much more about cooling the jets, and learning to let go of that thinking a little bit. Pulling your emotional investments out of the depression AND the hope. Having less need to control it, assigning less meaning to it, understanding that you cannot FIX it. Getting over it truly isn’t about fixing anything, which can be very difficult to begin to understand.

It’s much more about allowing yourself to start thinking some lighter thoughts, allowing yourself to trust them, not needing them to become true today or tomorrow, but just gently enjoying the feeling of trusting something a little bit lighter. WITHOUT NEEDING TO LOOK FOR PROOF. And when depression comes thundering “NOOO I AM REALITY! YOU ARE KIDDING YOURSELF, YOUR VERY SOUL IS A LOSER SOUL”, just let it do it, but if you can, try not looking for proof of that either. Because the only reason you can find something that looks like proof, is because those things are self-fulfilling prophecies.

posts.com: holy shit I didn't realize we had a writers' workshop thread on /adv/ look at all the fucking paragraphs in here

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28245020
How does this compare with the shrooms episode? Maybe that allowed you to think a little bit lighter. But then when you smoked weed, you started looking for proof, and didn’t find any, you only found the proof that the depression was still here. Gotta allow yourself the frivolousness of not consulting the proof anymore. Not needing to be convinced you are getting cured. It’s the ultimate rebellion against the depression to just stop caring about it, no longer trying to fix it. It’s the thing with brainwashing yourself with positive thinking as well. You have to decide that you trust it.

For example, I would sit down with a piece of paper, and write how I wanted things to be. “It’s no longer difficult for me to do things that are good for me. It just makes me happy. I am ready to leave the depression behind, and in fact that is not even going to be a choice. I no longer fear eye contact. It’s just as if that problem never existed.” All the time allowing myself to feel them as if they are true. If you feel that you can’t do it, it’s because you don’t want to trust it. You don’t believe in it. “This is delusional!”… Alright, fair enough. But so is the god damn depression! And as long as you insist that the depression is based in reality, and the positive thinking is just lying, then you’ve locked yourself into the basement and thrown away the key. Imagine if you believed constructive things as vehemently as you now believe the depression. That’s really the only difference between you now, and the alternate timeline where you are happy. And isn’t it far more interesting to have the audacity to look at your life, with absolute assuredness that all that has happened so far was good for you? You’ll be the only guy in the room with something different to say. And it’s all because no one allows themselves the easy-going rebellion of deciding what they want to believe.

posts.com:

Because if you believe the lowest of the low, then you will never be challenged. There’s a safety in it. And that’s the secret, underlying motivation of depression.

My great-grandfather to my dad were glowies. The pay is lower than private sector, but there is security. You will get world-class healthcare, a pension, access to the Thrift Saving Plan (kinda like a 401k but much superior), and be employed until you retire. After your 1 year probationary period, you're basically untouchable unless you call people niggers.
If you want another agency, try to get one that is unionized with the AFGE or NFFE. Federal law enforcement does not have a union, but you're not really likely to need one. You can probably try for SSA or IRS, but I doubt they'd start you at that high of a GS level. If you want to stay within law enforcement, you can try for DEA or ATF.
Also, if you're willing to be in DC, try to get a non-supervisory GS-14 position. This is the comfy spot of getting >$120k yearly while not having the stress of the bullshit that a supervisory GS-14 or GS-15 gets.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>28246609
I was an FBI Agent for 5 years in San Francisco. I worked counterterrorism.

Every day was different. I conducted high-speed surveillances, search warrants, conducted arrests, processed evidence. I even took a case to federal court with a federal prosecutor - and we won! Many cases don't go to trial, though, because they are so airtight- the defense usually settles. Some people decide to take their chances.

One word of caution: there is a lot of paperwork. They don't show that kind of stuff on TV or in the movies. But it is a job that is definitely worth it! You will work with some of the most amazing people on the planet and help keep our country safe.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>28246985
The Best Part. Most of the people you work with, like the office "jackal." Whether it's a missing child or an absconder no one can find, he will dig and scavenge through every until he finds what he's tracking. So many really dedicated people.

The Worst Part. The rest of the people you work with: ranging from the "grey men," who rarely contribute anything of value or share in the work, to the few who are actively incompetent and toxic, but stay short of catastrophic. The can't be fired, won't quit, they make your job harder, and there's only so much room on the Island of Broken Toys. So, they get passed along elsewhere or (often) upwards, their issues left unmentioned.

The Simultaneously Best and Worst Part: The job can be stressful, tedious, made harder than it should be, and often involves not just finding needles in a haystack but also finding a piece of straw that will turn into a needle. But, complaining about all that it is like a SEAL bitching about being cold and wet: It isn't a side effect of the job — it is the definition of your job. Doing all that, though, probably helps you be a better person.

>>28246101
When you're surrounded by these types people, and you're not on your guard, these types of feelings will inevitably arise. If you let them they will drain you dry.

You should know, however, that your mother, though you may not be aware, has done you a favor by giving it to you straight. She says that you're a mistake, that you stress her out, that she would have rather not given birth to you. Listen to her; she is being honest with you. With her genuine feelings out on the table you don't have to delve through layers of deception in order to get to the core of her feelings. The problem for you, right now, is that you're projecting onto her a perception of her that doesn't exist. She sees you as a burden but you want her support? She thinks you're a mistake but you want her love? These are her genuine feelings, accept them and get on with it or don't and continue to get chewed up.

Your girlfriend is also exhibiting some of these characteristics which isn't surprising as people in your position tend to attract these types of people without effort. If you want to continue to be degraded and abused then you will be. Stand up for yourself and take your power back or it will continue to be drained to the point you snap and take your own life.

The problem with narcissistic types is that they keep coming. To prevent further degradation you should look into the Grey Rock technique and apply it. It's difficult to maintain, and it comes with some risks, but if you don't have a choice but to interact with your mom then you don't really have much choice.

If you want support with NPD/BPD types I recommend Lise LeBlanc's YouTube channel :
https://www.youtube.com/@LiseLeblanc

Out of the many people on YouTube who cover this topic she gets right to the point. She has also been through the ride herself which allows her to talk about NPD/BPD traits with tactical eloquence. You may find her helpful.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28246373
There's also another technique, though I can't remember it's pop-psychology term, where you set up false weaknesses for them to attack and destroy. These types of people want a pound of flesh and if they don't get it regularly they get vicious. So throw them a fake bone ever now and then, without them being aware, and they get satiated without it coming off your back.

Here's an example of this technique: say you get a good grade on a paper, don't tell them you did, if they push you about it tell them that you got a bad grade and let them chew you out over nothing. Since they're attacking a phantom weakness instead of a real weakness you don't sustain a substantial injury from it. This technique, like gray rock technique, takes some trickery to pull off but at this point it's a matter of survival so I would pull out all of the stops and do whatever you can to protect yourself.

With your girlfriend you can leave her but you don't really have choice with your mom for now. Later in life you will be able to make the decision to part ways from her but for now it would seem you'll have to protect yourself and maintain a reasonable sense of the relationship between you and her.

I've been a monk since 2018 and studying Buddhism and meditation since 2015.

posts.name: Monk
posts.com:
>>28237986
Don't know. Haven't died yet

But on a more serious note from the Buddhist perspective we look at birth and death is happening moment by moment.

So something along the lines of there is a self-like experience coming up right now and that self-like experience is also passing away right now.

And we have this idea that a particular self-like experience is not the same self-experience as will be happening a few moments from now or a week from now or when the conditions change.

So that's a part of Buddhist psychology is that we see this idea of a self that is born and dies as something very fluid and changing moment by moment..

what it means to bring life to this world.
having children, becoming a parent

posts.name: Monk
posts.com:
>>28238076
Well as far as becoming a parent in the world it's definitely something that puts you in a position of sincerity and brings a sense of constant meaningfulness into your life.

So naturally that's what a lot of people are going to strive towards or get attached to because we as human beings naturally need some way of living a meaningful life.

And being a parent having a child is a kind of sure way to experience that and so naturally people feel nourished they feel inspired they feel encouraged to live skillfully and to take care and you know this is how it all kind of works..

But we don't need to become a parent or to have a child necessarily to live a meaningful life.

We can seek out community, we can seek out high quality wisdom or compassion teachers, I find myself to really appreciate Buddhist teachers like Thich Nhat Hanh, Ajahn Brahm, Sister Dang nghiem.

Can all be found on YouTube...

And so we just kind of make our way of going in the direction of being more involved in life and living a more meaningful life.

And we can especially emphasize to be a good person and to be generous to do good deeds.

If you do good you feel good.

If you do bad you feel bad.

If you do more good and you do less bad you can do the math.

So the main thing we need to find out whether it's Buddhist or religious or atheist or whatever it is is how can we find supporting conditions in our life to do more good deeds and to reduce and step back from our unskilledful activities


It sounds very simple and intuitive but we need those reminders and those conditions to support us to continue doing that and not just stay in this animalistic realm of chasing after our desires and trying to avoid those things that are a little bit unpleasant.

So that's what I can offer now~

So a good way to begin into understanding Buddhism is to actually have an interest in understanding Buddhism.

>>28238143
One of the primary practices that we do as monks is to practice celibacy.

So that doesn't mean that we don't have sexual energy or that we don't have difficulties in practicing that but it's this kind of constant direction we have in our life to transform sexual energy into our meditation practice into our wholesomeness into our focus on doing good deeds and being a support for other people on the path.
So that's a big focus of monk life is that practice of celibacy and transforming sexual energy to be something more meditative and wholesome.

But we don't believe that sex is in any way bad it's just that it takes a lot of energy and it can be very primal and selfish and desire focused so as monks we practice to let go of that more and more.

There's not really so much infighting between different schools of Buddhism but there is some people who focus on the differences and disagreements and give a lot of attention and energy to that.

But it does happen.

Yeah I'm super happy to help you with getting into Zen Buddhism That's what I'm really about.

Go ahead and search for "Bhante Varrapanyo" on YouTube and you'll find my channel.

My most recent video is like a 100% direct introduction to Zen Buddhism so I highly recommend you check it out I just finished recording it live so it's quite a fair place to start.

So don't focus too much on what you've wasted or what you've done wrong or even what you've done right up to this point.

Rather understand that through the power of doing good deeds, mindfulness, and a willingness to let go of your attachment to certain things in your life you can totally transform the state of your mind and the overall state of your life 100%.

Start by prioritizing to do good deeds more and more, to do acts of generosity, to be a good person.

So start to prioritize that and look deeply at that

Once you start to make that a priority you can notice those things in your life that might feel good but ultimately or not skillful that means they don't nourish you they don't feed you on your path.

So you do those things less and less.

Alternatively you make the decision to do more and more good deeds, acts of generosity, cleaning up your room, volunteering, going for a walk in nature, so many different opportunities but you just need to do and to act from that good intention and you can really start to transform your life 100% trust me.

Tibetan Buddhism stands out as having major differences.

>>28241569
So we really need to know how to recognize entanglement.

When we become aware that we are getting tangled up in a situation emotionally psychologically materially that's our reminder to step back.

That stepping back doesn't mean that we change the situation that we rejected or that we do something in particular.

What it means is that we step back from our reactivity and ownership of that situation.

We come back to our breathing we come back to our awareness of the body in space whatever space it is that it's in right now.

And really get grounded recognize where you are here and now.

From that place you can consider you know how can I take care of this situation as a caretaker with a parental mind.

Also with this understanding this wise understanding that everything is impermanent everything is changing.

That relationship that struggle that conflict that place is not essential to your freedom your peace or your happiness


Actually it's something that is just coming up and it will surely go away.

So try to see it and understand it in that way.

And as someone who's invested and wants to take care of that other person you need to be really careful to take care of yourself in this journey and set the boundaries you need to take.

But don't be shy to take those moments to step back and let go cuz that's really what's going to give you the space to deal with these situations in a wholesome contemplative and balanced way rather than a reactive way or being stuck in the stream of it all.

Good luck Be gentle be patient and be ready to let go at any moment.

Letting go doesn't mean rejection but it means not being trapped in a self fixated story where you need to do something or you need to not do something.

Any kind of actions that we take based on rejection are going to be problematic and quite difficult.

So is someone who's dealt with addiction or trauma you need to be careful that your actions are not foundationally related to you trying to get rid of or to reject something.

Because ultimately whatever arises passes away it's temporary and if we fixate on the thing we want to get rid of and we try to use force to get rid of that in a certain way we are fueling that energy even though it's a resistance or a rejection of it we're still feeding that idea and our belief in that idea.

Look into gabor mate on YouTube.

He has a lot of really high level strong talks about trauma and addiction.

Also keep in mind that we need to live a full spectrum life.

We can't just isolate one thing that causes us to suffer and then consider that getting rid of that or hyper focusing on that in some way is somehow going to make our life not suffering.

We need to find a way to live a meaningful life that includes being in community, doing good deeds, practicing generosity, and in some sense kind of adventuring exploring mind training

For me that's Buddhism

The hard truth is most guys aren't cut out for casual dating, like most guys aren't cut out for being professional soccer players or going to med school. You said you were a virgin so take my word for it, women literally come out of the woodwork when you have a social life. You're with some people at a get-together and a girl brings a friend you've never met before. Some boomer you're friends with at work brings his niece one day and you hit it off. Women who wouldn't give you the time of day on Tinder are much more likely to give you a chance if you meet regularly.

Think of it like a Markov chain in a video game, and working on yourself improves the odds of a girl who wants to fuck spawning in the background. Just work to get rid of your negative qualities and let RNGesus do the rest.

Too many guys focus on things they lack instead of qualities they already have but need to get rid of. I think improving your social skills is about developing the self-awareness to see the things in you that repulse others, and doing your best to get rid of them.

This. You lost your early account creation visibility boost, and are now being shown to women based on your Elo rating. Dating apps show the most desirable men to women first (and vice-versa). Because no girl is going to spend 3 hours swiping on Tinder like a man would, this effectively means you'll get zero matches, unless you're Chad and your Elo rating is very good.

You can rehabilitate your rating by buying Tinder Gold and setting your location to the Philippines for awhile. Buying Tinder Platinum is a way to bribe them into pretending your Elo rating is as good as Chad's so you can actually get matches again.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28246669
Whenever you can, you catch yourself when you have those thoughts and you say "fuck you" to the part of you that had them.

Then you do something positive for yourself. Actually positive, not some hedonistic bullshit. You do some pushups. You clean your room. You call someone you love. You eat something healthy.

It's hard. You will fail sometimes. You will feel like shit sometimes and you will not want to do it. You will want to be lazy and despondent and fall into old habits, but you need to start telling the ugly part of your brain to go fuck itself.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28246669
Your brain will fall into familiar patterns you condition it to follow - if you let yourself doomspiral, you'll get better at doomspiraling, if you practice self-love, you'll get better at that too.

Catch yourself before allowing these thought patterns to roost too long and consciously decide
>nope, not doing that.
>What's something I'm happy about and grateful for in the present, or something I can take pride in having done today?
and
>Is there anything else can I do today that will make things a little better tomorrow?
Then repeat until you get used to maintaining a positive outlook instead.

If the above doesn't work, seek a professional to talk with, they can help you with this.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Never had a real hobby other than playing games and I want to change that. I was thinking of trying out any hobby that sounds even slightly interesting and can be properly explored in a reasonable timespan like a week or 2.
I'm willing to pay but not too much incase I don't enjoy the hobby. But buying tools for 1 painting, 1 puzzle or modelkit to finish or a ball or something is fine.

Has anyone tried something similar, 1-2 weeks enough? Looking for any advice that might be useful before I begin.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28244450

You may not even need to buy supplies for a week or two. Take a peek at community college listings, museum events, meetup.com, etc. and see if you can find cheap one-off classes. Basic painting class, cooking, sewing, whatever you happen across that catches your eye.

Keep in mind that when attending classes or events you're also trying to make connections with other people. You might hit it off with somebody who's been into your hobby for years and has basic tools they're happy to loan or give you or you just find a group of people with whom you enjoy doing whatever that hobby is. When you have people you're excited to spend time with, it amps up your passion and helps you troubleshoot problems in learning.

Tldr: look for cheap or free classes and look to build relationships with the people you meet, the vast majority of enjoyment I get out of my hobbies is sharing them with the people in my life.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28245384
Yes, it literally makes more sense to think that the Earth is secretly flat and gravity is a lie (which is the only way a flat Earth could exist.
Decreasing the concentration of something will necessarily reduce its impact. Reduction to the extent that most homeopaths would do will render the "active ingredients" so uncommon that it will have essentially no impact.
The idea is that the solvent used to dilute is somehow different based on the initial solute. This is simply false and is not held up in any laboratory environment. Our technical instruments now are so advanced that we would be able to detect differences in the solvent, supposing that homeopathy was real.
The proposal is also quite strange on the face of it. Even if solvents can maintain some "memory" of the initial solute, why would that "memory" necessarily have a beneficial impact on the human body? It's just odd.
I actually think homeopathy is quite interesting as a pre-modern proposal and can see why people back then were interested in it, but I hesitate to even say as much for fear of validating it to you. I only say that much because people in the 19th century and earlier were genuinely clueless and had no direct means to disprove homeopathy (which we can now).

Why do you feel like you have no choice? Is there a particular substance that you think will help you that homeopaths generally use? If such a substance can truly help you, it would be better to get it in a form that will deliver enough active ingredients to render some effect upon you.
I honestly think it should be illegal to sell homeopathic medicine. It isn't harmful or anything, but it's the most deliberately duplicitous advertising imaginable. They are effectively selling bottled water.

Everyone else was in another room, but we were there for a while just talking.

Anyway, she left me the day before Thanksgiving 2018. I was driving home from buying my first typewriter when she texted. I don't remember it verbatim, but it was something along the lines of 'I don't like where the relationship is going now, I feel like we never do anything together'. Our last date was a couple weeks before, but we hadn't been going out because she would always say she was tired when I asked if she wanted to go somewhere. I was still - and in a lot of ways I am now - a kid, so I just took it in stride. The way most men do where it's cool first, sad later. I never took time to process it, because I just let everything numb me out for long enough to hit 2020, and then we all know how that went. Three feet on the gas, you get it.

That July I texted her just to see how she was, we talked for a few days. Doing good, not hostile at all. I made a mistake when I sent her a letter just to say I hoped she was doing well and that I think a little part of her will always be in my heart. A mistake, I say, because she showed it to all her friends, said it was written like a serial killer would. Blocked me on everything. Been having an insane amount of dreams about her lately especially, maybe I finally have the time to process it. She's there when I close my eyes, feel her hand in mine in my mind. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
A wild HERO enjoyer. Great choice in best OMORI boy.

Judging by how you're asking anonymous advice on the internet, let's say your life feels right now, like you NEED this boy in your life. he completes you.
The truth is, he does not. A partner should share your complete life, not make up for half a life.

Well, he still cares about you, so that's good!
The fact there's another boy makes this sticky, though.
Have you let him know you want him back, or that you want to "talk", as it is?
He's too hurt to take you back, but still texts to see if you care?
Are you okay with that scenario, providing him emotional support while he's dating somebody else?

I would suggest making your intentions known.
Here's where it gets difficult. Some might say it's manipulative, i think it's self protection.
If he says no, you don't stick around as friends.

So you bow out gracefully. Wish him the best. Don't leave a bad impression or argue or get upset. this is important later.

Now, you work on yourself. Hit the gym. Make new friends. Get a job. Coffee date some other people, even if it's bad. Go back to college. Whatever you have to do that you're not doing because you're currently worried about boys. Avoid the temptation to go back.
Some people have bullshit rules about "90 days" but that's bullshit. Just give it as many months as you need before you're actually more confident in your life.

After some months of this, say 3-6 months, no specific date... Do you still want to reach out to him? Is your life more accepting of a partner?
Then do so. He might be impressed by the person he sees. He'll remember the way you left on good terms. He's probably over the rush of seeing somebody new, as well, and can give it a more objective look if he wants to go back to you or stay with the new boy.

And if it doesn't work, you still come out with everything else you've improved in the meantime. To be cheesy and quote HERO. Life gets better, you just have to make it. You keep moving forward.

Similarly, women tend to have a better sense of smell than men. You fuck a girl and come home without showering, she'll smell the sex on you. Come home having showered thoroughly and scrubbed off all the sex smell, and she'll wonder exactly what you've been doing that required you to shower quite so thoroughly before coming home. Do you have an excuse ready?

Alibis are also tricky to maintain as soon as they involve anyone else - if you claim you're doing something work-related, for example, and you aren't, sooner or later she will call the office and ask them to pass on a message to you, and they will tell her that you aren't where you said you are.

If you play around anywhere near home, she or someone she knows will eventually spot you.

So the only way you can do it is to choose a career that *genuinely* requires you to do a lot of travelling - things that require you to be away from home for a couple of nights in a row. And not for things like conferences where other people from your company can see what you're doing - a job that requires you to travel solo. When you are in a completely different part of the country (or abroad) pick up a girl in a bar, take her back to her place, bang her, give her a false name, and leave. That way there's no chance the girl you bang can trace you; if your gf tries to contact you she'll just call your regular phone (which is off for a while) or contact the hotel where you are actually staying to leave a message, and she will have no reason to suspect anything.
